page.title: 07Ganger Farm - a visit
page.content: {Ganger Farm, Jermyns Lane, Ampfield. Ganger Farm is used for growing pick your own fruit and vegetables and for breeding beef cattle. The farm covers a total of 143 acres set out so: 25 acres rough grazing; 15acres fruit and veg.; 21 acres barley; 13 acres woodland and the rest grass. 80 head of cattle are kept on the farm. 60-70 of these go to Salisbury or Winchester market or straight to the slaughter house. The soil is clay over gravel and due to a valley drainage is natural. Every year 500,000-800,000 gallons of water are used on the crops. This is pumped from reading beds by a deisel pump. Many different machines are used on the crops such as: hay bailers, cabbage planters, and ratovaters. The crops are sprayed and the cattle are innoculated annually. The farm is clean and profitable
